Ok, I managed to figure it out. 
First you need to fix the image problems. That is explained above. 
Then mount CD1.cue in Deamon Tools and open it. Then you should be able to install the game (choose full installation).
It is possible to play in XP, but it has a few bugs. The most important bug is that you can't continue a game from the main menu. You'll have to start a new game and press F1 when you can control your character (there's a cinematic and some talking first).
Also, the sound is turned off in the beginning (at least it was for me), so you'll have to turn it on (through F1) to hear the voices and music.

This is by far the best Discworld game, enjoy it. Glad to see the torrent well and alive again, with 3 seeders and 12 leechers.
If you have any other questions, just ask.

You don't have to change the file names.  I used Alcohol 120%.  I placed the files onto Alcohol in this order:
CD3.IMG
CD2.IMG
CD1.IMG

Next right click on CD3.IMG and click mount on device.  Do the Full instilation and when it prompts you for disc two right click on CD2.IMG and click mount on device.  Then when it ask for disc 3 right click on CD1.IMG and click mount on device.  That is all I had to do and it installed it succesfully onto my computer which is XP.

When you click on it to play it will ask you to insert disc one.  Just remember to right click on CD3.IMG  and click mount on device and give it a second to load it up then click ok to play.
